column4: does anyone know ip address of packages.freecontrib.org. it in't working and am unable to upgrade to edgy?
plf packages?  if so, it's no longer maintained.
then where are those packages previously in plf maintained now?
i don't know.  http://plf.zarb.org/ says it's shutting down for ubuntu.
damn....I hope my edgy upgrade goes fine
can you remember off-hand what you installed from there?
nope. know any command to query?
perhaps mplayer codes or something
if you can hold on for a min or 2, i'm trying to come up w/ a command for you.
thanks. sure
it might be a bit simpler to try using filters in synaptic rather than trying dpkg commandline options ad nauseum.  ever looked at the filters?
nope :(
pretty simple.  open synaptic.  settings...filters...
am using kubuntu
i'm trying to come up w/ a command line for you.  just a min....
tried apt-cache dump |grep plf
returns two versions. now how to know which packages have that version
good...and you're sure that plf packages are the only foreign ones you've installed?
got it libdvdcss2 and w32codecs
ya rest are all main, multiverse ones
you should be good to go, then.  you can get both of those elsewhere.  you just might have to reinstall them after you upgrade.
hmm I guess so. my dvd drive gives a lot of problems without them. but I think I shud be good on once the repo comes up
thanks for the help
